channel.title: Peer to Peer
channel.description: I have heard that Peer to Peer means that people can gain access to some things and if they get access they come to your house and steal your stuff. Is this true? P.S. If you don't follow: Basically, if you use P2P programmes, if people find out where you live, they can come to your house and steal stuff. Is this true?

usenext is very good

item.title: Peer to Peer
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

When using P2P applications, people can, of course, find out your ip and relative location. But I honestly don’t know of any program that will determine the your actual street address/number (normally it just ends with you isp’s closest hub). It is pretty much impossible that you will have people burgling your house just because you use p2p apps.

Read full topic
